tweets.text:
Did you listen to @JennyNewhamEA on @BBCRadioKent today? Our need for volunteer flood wardens.

Interested? 

To find out more, go to https://t.co/pI0bHmsMk1

To register for virtual training, Wed 24 Feb, go to https://t.co/o4yDEipze7 - search for Kent Flood Warden Training https://t.co/kBCItUWlli

urls.title: Flood wardens | Kent Prepared
urls.description: Flood wardens are volunteers trained to help and prepare people in local communities that are at risk of flooding. They play an important role in the preparing a community flood plan and putting it in to practice. They also provide a vital link between a local community and those responsible for responding to a flood. You will be the eyes and ears of the community and will help develop your local flood plan. You can choose to meet with other flood wardens in your community as often as you like, typically

tweets.text: Joined other @welshharpies cleaning up the endless rubbish in the reservoir & SSSI. The extent is colossal. Tyres, sanitary towels, cans, wet wipes, plastic bags, builders waste, bottles..so sad for the birds that live here. It‚Äôs quite overwhelming but every bit cleared helps! https://t.co/4gRqdrt2Ev

@CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @BBCNews @robertlargan @RuthGeorge6 @HighPeakBC Monitor the situation? It's been a week. Yes, the polluter is the one at blame here but you are responsible for stopping the spread of this pollution and you've had a week to do something. Visiting and monitoring isn't stopping the pollution from spreading or from removing it.

Oh god, double whammy - pollution event no2 - pumping  polluted water from crushed concrete into #ShuttertonBrook - watched them doing it. I‚Äôm so sick of people abusing the Environment, seems endless and who is monitoring them? @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW #Dawlish #Devon https://t.co/g9FzlzbLKH

A week ago, oil pollution began entering the Peak Forest Canal at Furness Vale. We contacted @CanalRiverTrust EVERY DAY. After 5 days of inaction we went public to get them to take it seriously. We thought they had, but a week later the spill is spreading and worsening. 1/3 https://t.co/tD9bGkkFik

tweets.text: @SusCatSol @cumbriawildlife @unitedutilities @EnvAgencyNW Hopefully we see some more of these further up the catchment then, it‚Äôs the intake of main reservoir that needs slowing but that will be private land. Not having a go at your work, I‚Äôll pop n have a chat one day.

@ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA As a resident of Cumbria, the low sensitivity of the fells caught my eye. They don‚Äôt have much soil moisture deficit especially after 170 mm over two days. https://t.co/LVUXXxlOQK

Wonder how @EnvAgency  @bradfordmdc etc would like living with a packed bag since 2015 and being frightened stiff every time they smell a bonfire because a man put a massive out of control tyre dump next to their house & now wants to make that even worse?
@DrEdHenderson @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA I *think* it's simply a different presentation of soil moisture deficit Ed but I don't have the report to hand so I'll correct myself if I am wrong.

We are working with partners to ensure the safety of residents and the containment of the incident. 

Follow the advice of the emergency services, and call 999 if you are unsafe. https://t.co/5er1XMA1Qj
@ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA What are the criteria for sensitivity to rainfall?

@Tom_Randall Please can you work with @RuthEdwardsMP and persuade the @EnvAgency (with some public funding aid) to allow the public to cross the #RiverTrent on their bridge over their #sluice at #HolmePierrepont.  Should be an easy win, and connect two great local green assets.
@colwicknews https://t.co/0C6ySA0k6U

#stormchristoph may be long gone but this map shows just how sensitive it has left our catchments to any further rain - and there is a lot of this winter to get through yet. As we prepare for any future storms you can too by checking your flood risk here https://t.co/O5a99LbRVQ https://t.co/dTrgMcpQ3C

tweets.text: Part of nottinghams flood protection scheme is the sluice gates at Holme Pierrepont. #NG4 https://t.co/iS1ICEMvQx

@srhodes81 @cumbriawildlife @unitedutilities @EnvAgencyNW All feedback welcome! We believe there‚Äôs no silver bullet for flood mitigation. Natural Flood Management is designed to compliment hard engineering. Small numerous NFM adds up to a big impact. Birds Park is a great publicly accessible site to demonstrate lots of NFM techniques.

Even if someone you hire fly tips your waste ‚Äì you‚Äôll end up with a fine. Before you hire a waste disposal service ask for their Waste Carrier Licence number, a receipt and where they dispose of waste. Check this information on the @EnvAgency website. 

#KeepKentClean https://t.co/Q5gGDzOI55

tweets.text: Dear @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgencyNW please could you give an update on how this is being resolved https://t.co/9d1xW8kTQv

@SusCatSol @cumbriawildlife @unitedutilities @EnvAgencyNW I get the idea, it just screams wrong place to me. Surely anywhere outside that lump of land would be a better way to create new habitat and slow the flow more efficiently.

@SusCatSol @cumbriawildlife @unitedutilities @EnvAgencyNW What‚Äôs the point in the Swales I‚Äôve never seen water run down where you have put them in. Not seen deer, badgers or heard owls up here since you started, certainly doesn‚Äôt seem like habitat improvements in my eyes

@UnderwaterMedia @YorkshireWater The work you do to hold water companies, @EnvAgency -and @DefraGovUK to account is tremendous. All these bodies have abrogated their responsibilities to our rivers so we need people power to bring about change.

@CertusCC @YorkshireWater Was just unfortunate i could not get into the thick of it but really did not fancy my mask getting dislodged in limited visibilty, safer to head back when it is clearer. Certain alot would be dissapointed.

Just reported the oil spill to @EnvAgencySW somewhere around Plymouth. As I had Heard nothing from the EA so far about it. Found another bird covered in oil, this one didn‚Äôt make it. Everything on the beach is covered In the stuff. Seems pretty bad @CwallWildlife @DevonWildlife https://t.co/BjQN0KUdXc

Thank you @TheParksTrust, @EnvAgencySE & @AnglianWater for this interesting article on #MiltonKeynes' flood defences. How long do you think the balancing lakes etc will suffice as the climate changes? https://t.co/1BRgm6OGFQ
